availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

person.persName: Joseph D. Morton (Hopkins Co., KY, farmer)

body.p: Hopkins County, Kentucky, farmer. Hopkins County, Kentucky, native. Married to Deborah C. Morton. Father of Sarah J. Martin, Mary M. Morton, Marion E. Morton, Richard Morton and Adolphus Morton. Married to Mary Winnifred Bailey Morton in Hopkins County on December 20, 1855. Father of Henry Morton, William Morton, and Ella Morton. Farmer in Hopkins County in 1850. Owned one enslaved person in Hopkins County in 1850. Household owned one additional enslaved person in 1850. Farmer in Hopkins County in 1860.

ab.bibl:
Seventh Manuscript Census of the United States (1850), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Hopkins County, District 1, p. 97B.
Seventh Manuscript Census of the United States (1850), Slave Schedules, Kentucky, Hopkins County, District 1, p. 681.
Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Hopkins County, p. 812-13.
Ninth Manuscript Census of the United States (1870), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Hopkins County, Precinct 2, p. 24A.
